Policies and Initiatives.title: How AI is helping researchers revive cultural heritage; Explained
Policies and Initiatives.summary: AI is aiding researchers in reviving cultural heritage through digitization efforts. In India, over 10 crore pages of historical documents are now available online via the Abhilekh Patal portal. This digital archive is a significant step in preserving the country's cultural heritage, making it more accessible to researchers and the public.

Policies and Initiatives.title: Dell, NxtGen to build 'India’s largest AI training cluster' under sovereign cloud
Policies and Initiatives.summary: Dell and NxtGen are collaborating to build India's largest AI training cluster under a sovereign cloud project. The project will utilize over 4,000 NVIDIA GPUs to enhance domestic AI computing capabilities. This initiative aims to support enterprises, startups, academia, and government entities in India.

Policies and Initiatives.title: 60% of businesses confident in scaling AI, but gaps remain: Nasscom Report
Policies and Initiatives.summary: Indian businesses are showing confidence in scaling AI, with 60% expressing optimism, and many prioritizing Responsible AI, with 30% having mature practices. The BFSI sector leads in AI maturity, but challenges such as hallucinations and privacy concerns remain. Businesses with higher AI maturity are better prepared for emerging technologies, but require framework updates for advanced AI systems.

Events.title: WaveX Invites Applications for India AI Impact Summit 2026
Events.summary: WaveX is inviting applications for the India AI Impact Summit 2026, an event focused on artificial intelligence. The summit aims to bring together experts and innovators to discuss AI's impact and potential in India. Applications are now open for those interested in attending the summit.

Events.title: India–AI Impact Summit 2026
Events.summary: The India–AI Impact Summit 2026 is an upcoming event focused on the impact of artificial intelligence. Details about the summit, including its date, location, and agenda, are not specified in the provided information. The event is expected to bring together experts and stakeholders to discuss AI's influence and potential in various sectors.

Events.title: Digital India Ask Our Experts | Episode 41 | India AI Impact Summit 2026
Events.summary: The India AI Impact Summit 2026 is hosting an episode of "Digital India Ask Our Experts". This episode, numbered 41, aims to discuss the impact of AI in India. The summit brings together experts to share their insights on AI's role in shaping India's digital future.

Major AI Developments.title: Dell Technologies and NxtGen partner to build India’s largest AI factory
Major AI Developments.summary: Dell Technologies and NxtGen are partnering to build India's largest AI factory, utilizing Dell AI Factory with NVIDIA for scalable and secure infrastructure. This partnership aims to accelerate India's AI mission and support large-scale AI development nationwide. The collaboration will enable NxtGen to expand its AI services across the country.

Major AI Developments.title: Indian, US researchers develop AI-based eye scan to detect diabetes
Major AI Developments.summary: Indian and US researchers have collaborated to develop an AI-based eye scan that can detect diabetes. This innovative technology uses artificial intelligence to analyze eye scans and identify signs of diabetes. The breakthrough has the potential to provide a non-invasive and efficient method for diabetes detection.

Major AI Developments.title: AI and unstructured data: A roadmap for India's digital transformation with elastic CEO
Major AI Developments.summary: Elastic CEO discusses the role of AI in India's digital transformation, focusing on harnessing unstructured data. The conversation highlights the potential for AI to drive innovation and growth in India's digital landscape. Elastic CEO provides a roadmap for leveraging AI and unstructured data to achieve India's digital transformation goals.

Major AI Developments.title: How AI-driven platforms are transforming Rs 32 lakh crore Indian retail market - What EY NASSCOM report revealed
Major AI Developments.summary: A report by EY India and NASSCOM reveals that AI-driven platforms are transforming the Indian retail market, valued at Rs 32 lakh crore. The report predicts that 2026 will be the year of "Productive Retail," driven by AI advancements. Generative AI is expected to boost sector productivity by up to 37% by 2030.

Major AI Developments.title: PwC India report projects AI to unlock USD 550 billion across five sectors by 2035
Major AI Developments.summary: PwC India's report projects AI to add $550 billion to five key sectors by 2035. The report introduces a 3A2I framework for scaling AI, focusing on access, acceptance, and assimilation, as well as implementation and institutionalization. This framework aims to unlock broader public and economic benefits from AI adoption.

Major AI Developments.title: India’s AI ambition: Can the country turn potential into real-world impact?
Major AI Developments.summary: India's role in global AI is expanding beyond tech talent to include AI design and deployment in enterprises, driven by Global Capability Centers. However, scaling AI beyond pilots poses challenges such as data and integration issues. The focus is now on executing AI solutions that deliver measurable business impact, with approaches like Agentic AI being explored for complex operations.

Major AI Developments.title: AI-led data centre expansion gathers pace in India amid power, policy challenges
Major AI Developments.summary: India is experiencing rapid growth in AI-led data centre expansion, driven by increasing demand. Despite this growth, the industry faces significant challenges, including power shortages and unclear policies. The expansion is expected to continue, with companies investing heavily in Indian data centres to support AI and other emerging technologies.

AI Start-Up News.title: Over 100 Indian AI startup founders moving to US for funds and talent
AI Start-Up News.summary: Over 100 Indian AI startup founders are relocating to the US in search of funding and talent. Several startups, including Composio and Meetstream.ai, have already made the move over the past couple of years. Others, such as Smallest.ai and Beatoven.ai, are also shifting their base to the US.

AI Start-Up News.title: AI film studio TakeTwo secures funding at Rs 100 Cr valuation in pre-seed round
AI Start-Up News.summary: TakeTwo, an AI-native film studio, has secured funding at a valuation of Rs 100 crore in its pre-seed round, with participation from Afore Capital and Inovia VC. The company, founded by Y Combinator's AI Startup School alumni, aims to be a key technology partner for India's film industry. The fresh capital will be used to develop technical infrastructure and scale its team of creative technologists.
